text.content: You can add a new software license using the legacy Software Asset Management
For information about the fields in the
Read-only. Name of the software license. Created automatically.
Model category for the software license.
Software model of the license you are matching to. For example, Microsoft Excel.
Number of entitlements to be granted by this license. If an enterprise contract is attached to the license, the Rights field does not display.
Number from the asset tag. The tag contains the serial number and bar code for tracking the software license.
Current status of the software license, such as
User currently assigned to this software license.
User or department that maintains the software license. Can be different than the owner. For example, a specified user can own a software license, but the IT department manages it.
User or department with financial ownership of the software license. Can be different than the manager.
Parent asset of the software license, if any. For example, the parent asset of Microsoft Word software is often the Microsoft Office suite.
[Optional] A single metric which the software license is counted against.
More details about the software license stage. The available substate settings depend on the
selected. For example, if you select the
state, the substate options available are
Where the license will be used. For example, a specific site, country, or region.
Date on which the software license was assigned.
Date on which the software license was installed.
Information about the software license that would be helpful for others to know.
